channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report E-2024010229
item.description:
Report E-2024010229

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GrayMar Environmental Services was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft- by-2ft area of the concrete trailer yard and a 10ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that twenty (20) gallons of material was released due to a nail puncture from a pallet during offloading that damaged one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. GrayMar Environmental Services personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and recovered the spent material and containerized into one (1) 55- gallon metal drum. The damaged metal drum was over-packed into one (1) 65-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was stage onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010161
item.description:
Report X-2024010161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NOTIFIED BY DRIVER SUPERVISOR, OF A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN PACKAGE CAR ON ROAD. RESPONDER ACQUIRED LEAKING PACKAGE DECISION TREE, AND DONNED REQUIRED PPE. INSPECTION OF HAZMAT PACKAGE, REVEALED PACKAGE CONTENTS TO BE A CORROSIVE. RESPONDER USED CORROSIVE SOLIDS / LIQUIDS RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE ON PACKAGE CAR FLOOR. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED CONTAINERIZE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ABSORBED MATERIAL BACK TO THE SERVICE CENTER DMP AREA IN LINED SPILL TRAYS FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024010055
item.description:
Report E-2024010055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN3266 Galvbrite-EM release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of material released to a 1â€™ x 1â€™ area of the trailer and dock floor due to a puncture. The material was transferred via gravity feed into a new poly tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: DAYTON
  • State: TX

  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery it appears that the storage tank over-pressurized and allowed approximately 5 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. The customer made arrangements for the clean-up.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found crushed inside the trailer and was immediately removed from the delivery process DescribePack: the package contained two bottle of ZEP Industrial Purple degreaser. It was found crushed inside the trailer and the bottles completely open and almost empty DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately removed from the delivery process and was placed in a container before processing it.

item.title: Report X-2024010202
item.description:
Report X-2024010202

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was loaded incorrectly by either the driver or shipper. Package was loaded onto its side and not with arrows upwards, causing the loose cap to allow a leakage. Once discovered while unloading, the ruck was evacuated and absorbent mats were used to clean spill. A lined hazardous material red tote was used to transport the damage hazmat to the hazardous processing area. DescribePack: The root of the package's failure was the loose cap on one of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A quick clean up was done to mitigate the effects of the release. The area was cleared, and PPE was used in order to clean the spill properly and efficiently.

item.title: Report X-2024010267
item.description:
Report X-2024010267

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: BAYTOWN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The container was found in the unload. The container was immediately placed in an upright position to minimize spill. It was then placed in a red hazmat container with absorbent pads underneath. Spill was cleaned with absorbent pads. Hazmat spilled for less than a minute. And taken to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: the size of the puncture was the size of a pea. And leaked from the side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The container was put in a hazmat bucket to avoid more spillage. Absorbent pads were used to keep from leaking. And absorbent used to clean spill.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a one-gallon spill of regulated UN1090 "Klean-Strip Acetone" that was released at Terminal LAB. (1) a five-gallon metal pail was punctured by other freight during dock operations impacting Dock #21. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal who felt comfortable completing the clean-up with terminal-issued PPE.(1) 10-gallon poly drum containing the impacted "Oil Dri" absorbent material, the damaged metal pail, the remaining material, and issued PPE was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approx half a cup (UN1263) "CAT Standard Performance top coat" of paint released from one 5-gallon poly drum. The release impacted the concrete dock. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that the terminal staff was capable of cleaning the release with PPE on site. (1) 20 Gallon metal drum containing Product and PPE was created and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Pruett-Schaffer 66-13333 Clear Urethane Hardener was released from (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE and oil dri available on site. (1)10-gallon DM contains (1) 5-gallon DM of product, oil dri was containerized and left as waste onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023121166
item.description:
Report X-2023121166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was reported leaking during movement by UPRR yard personnel. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. The Tank car was found to have a broken Pressure relief device. The remaining part of PRD was bagged, covered, and the spillage cleaned off the car. The shipper is getting a new pressure relief valve and will get an OTMA for the car to be brought back to the loading rack to be unloaded.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was already in QA when hazmat team arrive. The package was wet and torn an all side and placed in a bag. On inspection, the package was damage due to internal leakage. DescribePack: One of the jerricans had a loose cap and leaked it's contents in the box. There is no content left inside that jerrican but the remaining three are in good condition. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was double bagged and place in a black tub for hazmat.

  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS HAZMAT WAS LEFT ON THE FLOOR IN THE CENTER OFF THE QA AREA, NO SPILLAGE AT THIS TIME THE LIQUID HAD ALREADY EXPELLED. AT THIS TIME PPE WAS USED TO PUT THE HAZMAT INSIDE OF THE YELLOW DRUM FOR SAFETY. DescribePack: DIDN'T SEE THE FAILURE HOWEVER IT WAS DROPPED AND ALL THE LIQUID IS EXPELLED FROME GLASS CONTAINER DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED INSIDE THE BLUE BAG AND PUT INTO THE YELLOW DRUM AND PLACE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE
